Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Daniel F
Reviews.Content: A fantastic birthday trip with my partner stays with us still and not because of the fond memories. We have bed bug problems and a potentially very expensive bill to fumigate our rooms looms. Not easy to cure. Other feedback says this is a known problem but it has not been fixed. I love to stay at the Holiday Inn (and Suites) but not this one. Very very concerned..

Reviews.Title: “Broken Promises!”
Reviews.Author: CDAglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is used by a lot of people who are having surgery at hospitals or private clinics. I'm here for a couple of sinus operations nearby over the next three weeks. As such I wanted a really nice room I could recuperate in. I looked at the rooms here and chose 1511 because it was large, had a balcony and was away from the elevators. When I booked the room online I requested that room. I also asked the Dr. office to request the room for the next surgery. Then I had a friend come in- in person to confirm the room. Then I called the night before my arrival to reconfirm the room and the rate because I wanted to have food delivered. So I fly in, arrive late as planned and not only had they given the room away, they put me in a room behind the elevators with no balcony. You've got to be kidding me. I have no other options to stay nearby so will stay put but this is about as bad as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Vancouver General Hospital”
Reviews.Author: lovemydogandhorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Vancouver Centre for 3 days in March 2012. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Vancouver General Hospital. The walk from the hotel to the hospital is a few easy blocks. I use to work on this section of Broadway so know there are always plenty of good restaurants and coffee shops (Tim Hortons or Starbucks) nearby. I booked a modern room with a king size bed on the 15th floor. The room was very fresh/new and comfortable with a lovely view of Granville Street Bridge and False Creek. Not being fond of heights, the small balcony was too scary for me and there were no chairs to sit on outside. The room was super quiet with a small fridge, coffee pot, iron and board , free wifi, daily paper and nice television so all the basic comforts were attended to. The heat/air conditioner unit was a bit loud when turned on but the “white noise” helped with sleep. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job of tidying the room daily. Check in and out were a breeze and luggage stored for collection later was handled promptly without issues. The lobby was partially under construction but had no effect on my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations have made this much better”
Reviews.Author: Caro281
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while on business. I stayed on the renovated floor in a queen sized bed room. The room was small however it was just myself and for that it was roomy. The furniture was nicely done, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom spacious. The only downside was the temperature. There seemed to be no inbetween; either I was overly hot with it on or really cold with it off. The lobby was being renovated while I was there as was the pool area therefore the hotel was offering a free breakfast. I thought the choices offered for food were excellent and greatly appreciated. The location is good with lots of choices for restaurants nearby and the skytrain within 3 blocks. I used the skytrain from the airport to arrive at the hotel and it was easy to navigate. The area also appears to be quite safe for walking in the evening alone.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation bumps”
Reviews.Author: YukonGirl73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location for both medical stays and central convenience when in Vancouver. However, it is currently under renovation, which was a bit of a pain. We had one of the newly renovated rooms which was really nice, but with all of the new carpet and furniture, it was a little smelly and we weren't able to get an air purifier, so that wasn't so pleasant. But with time that won't be an issue. The restaurant and pool were also closed and the renos made accessibility an issue. Admittedly though I did not read the online description well before I booked, so I can't complain about that. As compensation they did provide a free continental breakfast which was great too. If however you are looking to book here in the next few months and you are "scent"-sitive or have mobility issues, you might want to check with them first to see how the renos are coming along. Overall though it is clean, staff are helpful and you get the reliability of a stay at a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Improving on Excellence”
Reviews.Author: HetF
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about this place that left me worried, but it was an excellent visit. We arrived early, so our luggage was safely tucked away by the bellhop until checkin. Our rooms were a little dated and worn, but clean, and the bed linens were fabulous. Renovations were on-going at the time, but never impeded our visit and will greatly improve the quality once they are complete. I look forward to returning after the reno! Staff was polite and efficient. Breakfast was not included, but the morning buffet was quite good. The attached restaurant was absolutely excellent. We had most of our meals there and I'd go back in a heartbeat. There is a lovely gift shop inside the hotel with all sorts of unique items that I wish I'd had more time to peruse. Beautiful jewellery. Location is convenient and nice. We had no car, but found plenty in walking distance. Cabs showed up superfast. Will definitely stay again on future visits to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean055
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights due to medical emergency. Hotel is within walking distance of Vancouver General Hospital, BC Cancer Agency and other clinics. Hotel is definately 'under construction' but despite that, the staff were all very friendly & accomodating. The restaurant & pool are closed, but they have a continental breakfast which was great, all the basics included. The noise in the lobby was crazy, but i never noticed any noise in the room, we were on the 12th floor. Rooms are newly renovated, nothing fancy but simple & clean. Is also within walking distance to a handful of restaurants. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Construction mitigated but no pool/hot tub”
Reviews.Author: Cowtown_mama
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 12th floor at this hotel from 23-27 Jan 2012 while travelling on business. The hotel is renovating some floors, but this went unnoticed for the most part as I was working throughout the day anyway. The only disappointment is the hot tub was also closed for renovation, and when you arrive you have to walk down stairs into what looks like you are entering the service entrance, but it is their temporary front entrance during the renovation. Customer service here was great, and the room I stayed in was one of the newly renovated ones. Comfortable beds, ample space, and more than enough plug ins available. Nice shampoos/conditioner/mouthwash/shoe shine sponge/ shower cap and clean feeling soaps in the rooms. The rooms also have a nice blow dryer (not the usual tiny hotel blow dryer, but a real-sized, effective one). Close to a bus stop (just across the street), so you can take the #99 east to Broadway station to catch the sky train or connect with other routes to go downtown or to nearby sight seeing attractions. Great access from the airport - I just took the sky train to broadway station and walked to the hotel but if you have more than 2 wheeled bags or have difficulty walking I would suggest you take the #99 east to Heather Avenue and it will drop you off adjacent to the hotel. Overall I gave 3/5 due to the hot tub being closed, but I will be returning to this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: natchee
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay (2 weeks!) in a renovated room on the 15th floor in November. Great location for travelling throughout the Vancouver area on business without having to worry too much about downtown traffic. I've stayed here before the renovations and they are definitely a lovely improvement! Staff were super friendly and as others have mentioned, the hotel is undergoing renovations throughout and are totally up front about it. I never had an issue with noise as I was out of the hotel for most of the day while it was noisy. My one issue is that I was to be upgraded to a deluxe king room or whatever (w/ platnium IHG) but the king rooms don't have refrigerators and I was hoping to have one considering I was there for two weeks. There was going to be an additional charge (I think $10/day?) to have a fridge put in but the rooms with queen sized beds HAD refrigerators so I declined the upgrade and stuck with the room that had a fridge in it already. If I were the hotel, I would have considered putting fridges in all the rooms! Parking was easy and never full, just registered with the front desk. Great stay and I would stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient for medical visits”
Reviews.Author: DuncMorgan
Reviews.Content: This property is within short walks of Vancouver General Hospital, BC Cancer Agency and other clinics. While it is presently undergoing major renovations, they were up front about it both on reservation and registration. Noise was not intrusive and the newly completed areas are very nicely finished and furnished. Handy to a range of restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails1108
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week of business travel as it is close to the office. I was nervous about the bad reviews regarding construction and renovations. I had no problem...I was in a renovated room, and it was big, clean and had a nice view of False Creek. The hotel was what I would expect for this type of travel and was good value for the money. The only downfall was since it isn't downtown dining options past 9:30-10 pm were slim. And that includes room service.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: sgellert
Reviews.Content: I've been using this hotel a couple of times during the past 2 years. Always friendly service and good value for money. Easy access to Skytrain and lots of good restaurants nearby. A lot of improvements are being done to the hotel recently, which was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: sw123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights as part of a business trip. The hotel was conveniently located about a 10 minute walk from the office and that was the deciding factor. The room was on the 11th floor and I was initially concerned because it was right next to the elevator, but other than the occasional dinging from the elevator I never noticed any noise. I didn't have to deal with the staff at all but they were pleasant during check-in and check-out. The bed was very comfortable and the room I was in appeared to be newly updated with a nice bathroom and newer furnishings including a flat screened TV. I didn't spend a lot of time in the room, was there basically to sleep - felt very safe wandering around in the evening, even taking a walk down to the waterfront didn't cause me any concern. As others have mentioned, there are all sorts of eateries within a few minutes and most other stores as well. I didn't experience construction noise issues, but I was generally out the door by 7:00 a.m. It might have been nice to have a gym, but I got my exercise by walking around the surrounding neighbourhoods. I'll stay there again without any hesitation. It may not be for tourists but for anyone that has to be in the area, it certainly seemed fine to me.

Reviews.Title: “You know what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: KenWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: In general this hotel is not bad and is slightly less expensive than other hotels in the area. The location is pretty good in that it is a short walk from the Canada Line (subway/train). Taking the Canada Line from the airport is less expensive and faster than a cab. Get off at the Broadway/City Hall station and head west on Broadway. There is nohing fancy about this hotel but the staff are nice and the rooms are what you would expect from the Holiday Inn. Not great but clean and comfortable. The biggest draw back is the noise. Try to stay in the rooms on the west side and or south as there will be slightly less street noise. Bring ear plugs just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AOW_EANx
Reviews.Content: This was a very average hotel for a very much above average price. The two room keys provided would not open the electronic door lock, which required another trip to the front desk. Normally it would not be a big deal but, when one is dead tired, it was a needless irritant. The night manager accompanied me on the second trip and, between the two of us, eventually got one of the second keys to open the lock. The balcony door had slipped off the track, which meant the door could not be locked. Also, because it couldn't seal properly, lots of street noise got through. The hotel was full so they couldn't offer me another room. They offered to send up a maintenance person but I was tired and declined the offer. Judging by the condition of the latch, it had been a problem for some time as it was quite evident that people had been trying to ram it shut to get the latch to catch. The room was clean enough; the bed adequate; and the tv was a quaint crt unit (remember those?). Other than location, this property has nothing special to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: akabono
Reviews.Content: Two things made this a disappointment: 1) The swimming pool was closed for renovations. If you read their website, it had left the impression that the renovations were being in November but don't be mislead. 2) We went to the complimentary buffet breakfast only to be informed that, since we booked thru a 3rd party (Hotels.com), the buffet was not included in the room. Otherwise it was a decent business class hotel located just outside Vancouver Island (don't let the "Centre" foll you, it's like staying in Brooklyn when visiting NYC.) Plenty of reasonable restaurants (primarily Asian) within walking distance. Parking at the hotel was $15/night. There's a Starbucks and a Blendz (great bueberry scones) just outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Things That Go "Bump"...”
Reviews.Author: SteveParr
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here. The positives: Nice bar/restaurant on site Attentive staff Very nice, clean room Great location The negatives: Concrete on the balcony was filthy and had moss growing on it Renovation construction started very early in the morning, and it was noisy before 8:00am When I reserved this room, I reserved a room with a balcony. When I checked in, I got to my room and discovered it did NOT have a balcony, despite balcony rooms being available. The staff got me into a balcony room in short order, but it never should've been an issue. The morning construction was another story. Banging on the walls at 7:45am was rather unwelcome. As someone who travels on business, and does business from his hotel room, I had to contend with the incessant banging while on the phone. If I stay here again, I'll call first to find out if there is any construction and/or renovation going on. If there is, I think I might choose another hotel. If there's no construction or renovations happening, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “still undergoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: unhappymomma
Reviews.Content: as we stayed there in march the hotel was undergoing construction @ the time. we go to vancouver to see medical specialist so we are always there for @ week @ a time every 6 months now. the staff was very rude @ the front desk<< on the website it did not say anything about renovations which they tried to tell me it did. one of the main reasons we booked a room there was location & the swimming pool which was closed.. only 1 elevator was working and when it did show up 20 minutes later it was full of the construction workers so we had to wait even longer.. not to mention if u take the stairs from the 9th floor with a 3 year old & a stroller u always got to move the workers ladders out of the way..... i was just gonna book here again hoping the pool is open but after reading the reviews i will pass and stay elsewhere. also it sucked waking up @ 5am to listen to drilling & banging.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Nord2010
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms good staff, not good business ctr, have to pay to acess internet. Wi-Fi did not work in room.

Reviews.Title: “very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller21421
Reviews.Content: Since I read all the reviews before my trip, I did not have high expectations for this hotel. Howver, I picked it because the location was very important to me and I only stayed one night. I am happy to say that the room was quiet, spotless, yes somewhat dated, but acceptable. I did not see any sign of renovations, although the staff warned me of pool closures and gym closure. The restaurant breakfast was very reasonable, and for the first time, I saw fresh berries and lots of frest fruit on the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “ignore reports of problems: great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: montreal7565
Reviews.Content: reserved with some trepidation, given reviews. The hotel is very well-located, a 3-minute walk from the Skytrain, and thus has very easy access to downtown, the airport, bus to ferries at Tsawassen. The room had been fully renovated and was impeccably clean. Both elevators and working and I had no problems accessing my floor. the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. My room on the 6th floor had a wonderful view of the Burrard Bridge and Stanley park and distant mountains. there was some very muted power-tool noise during working hours, but absolutely no problems or noise between 5PM and 7:30 AM. the pool is still out of commission. As to complaints about the restaurant: frankly, anyone expecting gourmet food at a hotel restaurant is usually barking up the wrong tree ! There are many restaurants (Asian, Italian, vegetarian..) and coffee shops in the immediate area of the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Sar1910
Reviews.Content: HI Vancouver centre... is not center at all, but 4 underground stops from there, at least change the name! Hotels is an ugly '70 or '80th building, reception, restaurant and rooms as well. Breakfast was not a pleasant experience, croissants were at least 2 days old, and even if u r "b&b" they ask some 6 bucks extra for it! Rooms are and looks old. They say they r under renovations, meanwhile better to remove Hi sign, not to disappoint usual Hi customers, not expecting luxury service but for sure something better

Reviews.Title: “Everything worked that was available to work.....”
Reviews.Author: Feenee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally placed once you realize that the metro system has a stop just 2 blocks away- which we didn't until the end of our last day! The hotel is also close to the excellent Milestones restaurant. Undergoing renovations (desperately needed) the pool is closed at the moment. A new block is going up behind the hotel (3 meters away) and they start work at 7.30am. This is noisy but has also removed the view of Vancouver from any rooms on that side. Rooms are large and contain everything you need. The wifi is a bit flaky but there was an ethernet cable as well which worked fine for uploading to dropbox. Not a lot else to say- decor is tired but being addressed, the neighbourhood is fine with very many ethnic restaurants. Parking is on site and $17 a day for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Smart entrance, but tired above”
Reviews.Author: TravellerdaveUk
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of Holiday Inns, they really don't want you to be comfortable in your room, unless you're sleeping. Two huge beds, but only one pretty uncomfortable easy chair. The staff eventually found us another one, equally uncomfortable. After a long day seeing the City, we really wanted to relax, sitting, not lying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: khirina
Reviews.Content: I visitied this Hotel for a dual birthday getaway of one of my friends and I. The Hotel was great along with its amenities ( pool, business center, restaurant, room service ) the only thing is that we just realized that you have to pay for breakfast for a full service Holiday Inn, but it was our fault for not checking. Otherwise the entire stay was a success and we had a tremendous time.

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay Here If You Love Surly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaret32201
Reviews.Content: This is a old downtown Holiday Inn with small rooms and limited amenities. When we arrived there was a sign saying no pool, hot tub or workout room as they were undergoing renovations, so I asked for a discount. The very surly staff informed me that the price quoted was a dicounted price. We paid over $200.00 per night and our AAA guide said this was the normal rate. Any time I asked for anything at the desk I was treated like I had asked for the moon and they were only helping me because I would not take no for an answer! The parking is $18 per night extra even though the sign at the parking structure states parking to be $15.00. Stay anywhere else in the city and get a better deal and a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: dcpops
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled. Despite the renovations, this hotel is a pit. There's construction on one side of the hotel, so you're likely to be awakened at 5am, as we were. The lobby is frightful. The restaurant is expensive for mediocre food ($60 for a family of four for breakfast). And, the management couldn't have cared less when we complained about advertised amenities that weren't available or the construction. No matter the cost, I wish we had never stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: mikelima
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay. The hotel was undergoing some much needed renovations. The noise was not significant. Service at the front desk was good. Concierge? Our taxi driver helped us with our bags after he retrieved the trolley from the lobby. We had to push the trolley to the room ourselves. But that was ok considering the cheap price we paid. Whilst the hotel is not downtown, it is on West Broadway close to their train station. Trains run regularly and are cheap, even cheaper if you are a senior. Around the hotel are a wide range of restaurants and cafe, including an excellent Chinese restaurant favored by the locals. Breakfast in the hotel is expensive for the choice of food available. You are better off eating at one of the local cafes for half to one third the price. If you are into mountaineering gear etc. Just down the road is a huge store with all imaginable gear. Also along the same road are several other smaller but similar stores.

Reviews.Title: “Might be nice once the renovations are finished...”
Reviews.Author: cmdsea
Reviews.Content: Arrived here by car and after a looong wait for the elevator at the parking floor it arrived jam packed and we ended up having to walk 4 floors down a grimy escape staircase and out to the street before finding our way back into the hotel... Not a very nice welcome and not a good service for the C$17/day they charge for parking.... Turns out there is only one elavator in use for the whole hotel... this has been since January, and its now June.! Also, while they are at it, no pool and no gym, they are closed while they are being re-built too. After check-in and grumbling to the hotel staff that they should inform patrons of their renovations on the website so we can make an informed decision on whether to book or not, I was told rather defensively that this is indeed on the website. In that case it must be in the fine print as I dont remember seeing it. And hence the reason for this review to warn and inform other potential guests... Final point to note. When i asked for walking directions to Gastown, I was given a map and told to take a tgrain a few blocks away, 4 stops down to the town. This hotel might be called Vancouver centre but its not in the centre of town... you have been warned.!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Holiday Inn on 711 Broaday. This was a Horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelg5z222
Reviews.Content: I always feel safe by choosing Holiday Inn but this time I am really disappointed. I would never expect this from a Holiday inn. I made a reservation and paid in advance and checked into the Vancouver Canada hotel on Sunday afternoon. On May 8th. I picked this Hotel because it stated it had an indoor swimming pool. When I arrived in Canada and checked into the Hotel the front desk employee told me that the Pool was closed due to renovations. Me and my friend were very disappointed because we looked forward to using the pool. She did not really care and told us that we should have seen it was under renovation when we booked the hotel. No where did it say that you were under renovation. If I had known this I would have booked for another Holiday inn. I was very tired traveling and just got off a ship and I am not from Canada, do not know the area so we had no car and no choice but to stay at this hotel. Not to mention I had already paid for this hotel in advance. I want to let you know that the hammering started early in the am and I could not sleep in. when my friend took a shower I got in the shower about 15 minutes later and there was very little hot water. I had two minutes of hot water for myself. I would think that the hot water heater in a Holiday Inn would be able to accomodate two people. There was also only one elevator because the other one was closed down and on more than one occasion I had to wait 7 minutes for the elevator to open. Also when I was checking out I called the front desk to complain again about the elevator and told them I was trying to check out and it was 5 minutes til 12 and the elevator was not opening. I had a plane to catch and they never offered to come up and carry my luggage after I asked them where the stairs were located. Also cockroaches near the window. I complained to Holiday inn when I got home and all they did was send an e mail back to me thinking me for my "COMMENT" i Will never stay at ANY holiday inn AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Hotel under-construction toxic fumes”
Reviews.Author: algernonj
Reviews.Content: Stay away. The hotel is being renovated while still operating - the whole hotel is filled with fumes of carpet glues, paint, and other noxious construction smells. But, the hotel has only one elevator and it is jammed from 7 - 9 am by guest - 30 minute wait sometimes - and the maids block it from 9 -12. Guests must use the stairs up to the 16th floor. Many amenities are not operating. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: Renovations reduced elevators from two to one. Lots of nearby restaurants on Broadway. Staff was friendly. Close to really good public transit. Building and contents showing their age. Free luggage storage. However, there was nothing really compelling about this hotel that would make me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully Renovations will bring improvement”
Reviews.Author: Tommy-1955
Reviews.Content: We purchased a 2 night stay at this hotel thru a charity auction...there is no way I would have paid the rack rate. The room was incredibly clean but this hotel is old and tired. They are in the process of doing renovations and hopefully the upgrades will make a difference but I guess it depends on how far they go. We stayed on the 9th floor and the single pain windows were so poor, we could hear the audible signal for the crosswalk (all night long), The ice machine wasn't too far from our room and like the crosswalk, we could hear it every time someone got ice. Our room was a reasonable size - the beds (2) were comfortable enough as was the bathroom...very clean. We only had the A/C - Heater on long enough to bring the room to temperature as it was quite noisy. A mini fridge and microwave would have been nice. Breakfast was included and it was more than adequate - the staff in the restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: redcar_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of our 2 month trip around the world. We have experienced many different hotels and found the Holiday Inn to be one of the best in the way of comfort. Although the decor is in need of being updated it doesn't detract from the spacious rooms and bathrooms and very comfortable bed. The staff are very friendly and will go out of their way to assist you if needed. The view from our bedroom was stunning, although there was a tower crane as part of the view. Next time I come to Vancouver I will definitely stay at the Holiday Inn Vancouver Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: omara67
Reviews.Content: Generally in Canada, dont expect to be serviced so lower your expectations, though 4 stars hotel there is no Bellman, no concierge service, SERVICE does not exist in Canada. However the hotel has a breath taking view of Vancouver, the rooms are nice, breakfast is ok but don't look for any other food

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice..”
Reviews.Author: Rajeshahujamumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2010. It is a very clean and quiet hotel. The decor of the room was lovely, and there was almost no noise at all. The staff on the reception desk were extremely kind and helpful in providing us with the city information we required. When I return to vancouver, I will stay here without question, as the price is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: CMangnus
Reviews.Content: As of August this hotel is under renovation. We had Jack hammers one floor below us from 7:30am to 3pm. The room was small, cramped with a lumpy carpet and the elevator was so slow it became almost laughable. Full 10 minutes waiting for the thing to arrive at your floor. All for $154.00 per night. We moved over to the Park Inn less than a block away and had a great stay there. Avoid the Holiday Inn while under Renos. Ask when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: momwithlove
Reviews.Content: My brother and I were needing to go to Vancouver as our sibling was in Vancouver General Hospital. We had not stayed in this area and I had to book something that was within walking distance to the hospital. I researched and found this hotel. I also picked it because it had a swimming pool and a workout room. The day before we were to fly out i noticed a note on their website stating that their workout room and pool were closed for repair. I called to see if that was a current post and was told that due to damage the pool and work out room were closed. I expressed my disappointment. The staff were very understandable and offered to upgrade us to an executive suite with a balcony for free. While I was looking at their site i noticed that a complimentary breakfast buffet came with it I inquired and was told that we would not qualify. I told them i would rather get a free meal rather than a larger room as we would only be there to sleep after being away at the hospital a long time. They gave us the free meal. We arrived and took a cab ($30 trip) and were surprised to be offered not only the upgraded room but also breakfast buffet for all 4 days we were there. The room was comfortable and quiet with a beautiful view. We found that it was very close to Vancouver General Hospital and we walked there in less than 5 minutes. It was also very central to shopping, eateries, sites and a wonderful bus route that took us many places quickly. The breakfast buffet was very well laid out and extremely filling. The staff was very helpful and extremely friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Corrado179
Reviews.Content: A tired property - but comfortable beds and conveniently located. Tourist advice desk very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “handy situated”
Reviews.Author: Mimmeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated if you want to be downtown within no time but do not want to stay in downtown. The rooms are quite big but nothing more than standard. There is no minibar in the rooms. The windows are so bad, that the traffic is heard all night long - even the "beeps" from the traffic-lights. The breakfast is good. The meals and also the bar-menues in the restaurant/bar area are good.

Reviews.Title: “poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Desertpea_1
Reviews.Content: I found that this hotel wasn't value for money. The hotel itself was not unlike any other hotel: clean, functional, the restaurant was average etc. However, the wireless in the room was poor quality, they charge for internet usage on the computer downstairs and they also charged for local phone calls. I found at all the other hotels we stayed at across Canada, the internet was free for guests of the hotel and local calls were free. I was disappointed to find that wasn't the case here.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean,safe, good size.”
Reviews.Author: gottagettoNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights April/May. The mattress was COMFORTABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The room was a good size, I thought, with a queen bed, lots of room to move around and a bathroom that I also thought was a good size. It was very clean and neat. Vacuumed in all the corners. No bar fridge but I didn't need one. One of the two elevators was down so it made the rides up and down a bit slow, but they offset this with providing free continental breakfast in the restaurant. I found the hotel staff very pleasant and for the price (I paid $160 per night), it was good. Starbucks VERY close, A&W, sushi and other restaurants close by. I recommend it. Its not downtown proper but its close enough by bus/transit/cab.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: PeterP123
Reviews.Content: The room was infested. At first we didn't know but both myself and my wife woke up with multiple bites. It turns out the room had be bugs. The staff apologized vociferously, cancelled our charge and gave us another room. That one also had bed bugs. Our friends who were travelling with us said they had no immediate problems but when they got home they'd found that they had taken bed bugs with them. This hotel is infested! Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by outside appearance!”
Reviews.Author: philandalex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in adjoining rooms on the executive floor.The rooms where spacious and exceptionally well serviced.We have no complaints with regards to cleanliness and comfort. The staff where friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included which was standard fare but a big enough chocie to tempt even adolescent tastes!. The exterior is no reflection of the comfort we enjoyed, also great views from the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “an exceedingly ordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: qwertVictoria
Reviews.Content: Bare bones, styrofoam cups with the coffeemaker sort of place. A very very beige place offering what one needs but completely without style or dash. Think of a government department running a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Drakesmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night at this hotel for the location primarily. We were in town for the night to accomodate a day surgery my husband was having at VGH early the next morning. Exterior of the hotel not too impressive and hallways and rooms dated, but CLEAN. Staff very nice and could not ask for more. Price was in line for what we got. If I was staying for pleasure, would have picked a different location if I wanted to spend more money as well. Paid $165CDN taxes in. Did not eat there, so don't know how the restaurant is, menu looked good. Went up the road to Earl's and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay in vancouver before cruise to alaska”
Reviews.Author: weiss4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the holiday inn on w.broadway very convenient location. Many locations to eat at and great view from balcony. Got some great pic's as sun came up capturing the light and the mountains. Had a nice walk to Q.E. park. Beautiful to view. Took shuttle bus from hotel to cruise dock.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view from 16th floor.”
Reviews.Author: Sunrise6am
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed in the middle of the shopping area in walking distance of the harbour. Comfortable and spacious. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: anonymousPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August. We had a queen bed room which was not large but certainly adequate and seemed to have been recently redecorated. Our room faced the road and was next to the elevator but noise was not a problem (although the icemaker outside our room seemed to run frequently). Hotel is not downtown but is in a bustling area with many restaurants. Area seemed very safe. The new SkyTrain route opens later this month which should be only about a 5 minute walk and will be a convenient connection to downtown and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair1976
Reviews.Content: I'm a little perplexed by some of the bad reviews as we had an excellent experience at this hotel, good service and clean and tidy. Exactly what you'd expect from a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “'Commendable hotel' ? Far from it!”
Reviews.Author: TrueSingaporean
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the one in town (Hotel & Suites) because Intercontinental Hotel's website says this one is highly commendable (by who I wonder?!). The hotel is old, the reception staff is condescending, the room very small, the toilet bowl choked....there is no end to it. Even though we are 'Royal Embassador' member, so what? We took up another room with our points just to stay overnight as the room was way too squeezy for the whole family. We informed them about the choked toilet bowl in the first room (whose content just rose up whenever we flushed it and almost overflowed) but it was not fixed even after we returned at 10pm. None of the receptionists owned up to having received the call. Then they sent a kitchen helper to check the toilet bowl (huh?) When we asked to change the room they said the hotel is full. After insisting, they finally found one (give me a break!). The only good thing I remember was that they provided free shuttle to town. But even that the tone was demeaning when I pointed out that we were not leaving at 12am but 12pm when the staff made a recording mistake. We feedback to the duty manager upon checking out, he just listened but nothing else was done, er, how about a follow up email to apologise?

Reviews.Title: “Practical, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom02
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed one night using the "Park and Cruise" option. We parked the car in their lot for the 7 days of our cruise. The hotel has a nice pool, but the location is somewhat noisy. We had a fairly large room, but it badly needed updating and the carpet was stained. The ice machine in the hallway also was a bit noisy. On the plus side, they provided transporation to the pier in a large van which was very convenient, and the taxi ride back to the hotel from the pier to pick up the car at the end of the cruise was only $11 for all of us and the luggage. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bbr003a
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service with clean, comfortable & quiet rooms. Breakfast at the restaurant was good with speedy service. Baggage storage available and you can use print your airline boarding pass for free on the computers in the lobby. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do they know the meaning of executive suite??”
Reviews.Author: jessicaMontreal
Reviews.Content: The executive suite was TINEY!!! Apparently though, paying $20 extra a night doesn’t get you a bigger room it gets you ONE pair of crappy dollar store slippers, the use of ONE scratchy robe and getting to be on the 'seventh floor' which apparently is a 'big deal' because the word executive is written next to the elevator button.. The regular rate room that we stayed in after switching half way though was bigger and had a full sofa rather then a chair that we got in the 'executive suite' There is a pool but it’s not heated to swim at your own risk! The hotel is as promissed right down town. Over all not a bad stay but go with a regular room..

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arturo_8
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the hotel and it was a very nice stay. The hotel is really close to downtown and Granville Island. If you want to bus around Vancouver there are bus stations right at the hotel. If you want to go shopping the closest mall is Pacific Center, which was a very good mall. The front desk was very courteous and helped us out a lot when we needed it. The neighborhood feels very safe. The rooms are really comfortable. There is no wireless, which would have been great, but there is high speed. The hotel is a little bit old but it was a very nice hotel. I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: soniata
Reviews.Content: This is the third time this year that we have stayed at this hotel. Granted it may need some updating but it was very, very clean, friendly and a spectacular view of downtown! The bed and pillows were very comfortable and although there was no wireless service the high speed internet was all you would need and there was a great desk to work at as well! My husband and I felt safer walking around this hotel than any that you could stay at downtown. If you have a car getting around from here is great and if not, you can easily walk to a bus that will take you to where ever you have to go. Although we did not eat at this hotel (there were too many other wonderful choices minutes away) we found all the staff extremely friendly. It also has a very clean pool and exercise room. This hotel is perfectly priced to reflect the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dockgirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just recently stayed at the hotel. March 18th to 19th. I booked the executive suite for an extra $40 and it was nice. The fluffy down comforter and pillows were so wonderful to sleep on! And there was a pillow order form for those that had a preference for pillow firmness. The decor was of course a bit dated because the hotel is older but it was very clean. We had a problem with the coffee maker and I couldn't turn the shower on but within 10 minutes of phoning the front desk we had a tray of coffee sent up and a repair man to fix the shower. They aim to please. We had a complimentary breakfast buffet with our room. We didn't get down there til 10:00 am and it wasn't very warm and there was just slim pic kin's so I'd advise getting there sooner. I think I would just get a standard room next time and order breakfast from the restaurant or go out. We were very close to Granville Island. Take the bus, It's so hard to find parking! I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the city”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a stopover so wasn't intending to do much sightseeing. It's on the opposite side of the water from the main city centre and affords greats views. The rooms are decidedly shabby and the whole place is in need of an upgrade. The price is okay for what you get, but it isn't in a good location for tourist travel. There is a nice walk down to the water and along a path to Granville Island - but be prepared for the steep walk back. There is a direct bus to UBC if you are on university business.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, Could be worse.”
Reviews.Author: dino_martini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel inn Vancouver Centre for two nights in February for a Scrabble Tournament. It is a good hotel for the price. If you just want somewhere to lay your head at night and get a shower then its fine. The decor is a little out dated, but it was clean over all. The staff are nice and helpful. There is a taxi stand right outside the hotel and there is always atleast one waiting. We didnt eat at the hotel resturant, we went to an italian place about a block east of the hotel on Broadway called Favouritos based on a recommendation from the front desk (It was amazing! pretty resonable prices as well) and we ate breakfast at the Denny's about 6 blocks to the west of the hotel on Broadway. There are computers in the lobby area where you pay 3 dollars for 15 minutes of access and you can make an account to save any unused time for use up to 60 days later. The pool was clean, and pretty nice for the hotel. The weight room was good as well. There is no Casino in the basement, there hasnt been for about 4 months. Overall it was a pleasant stay. The Hotel is in sort of a noisy area, alot of traffic goes by, the street crossing signs beep, and a few ambulances go by every once and a while. But it just sort of blends into the backround. There are a few homeless people around, but they just ask you for change, nothing else. They dont want anything to do with you really. So, yeah it was good stay, ok hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: MintSliceFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and overall we enjoyed ourselves. The check-in was fast and polite and we got a complimentry upgrade to an excecutive suite with a king sized bed and balcony. The room was very comfortable and the bed awesome. I have never slept in something so soft and comfortable. The bathroom was okay, we found the water pressure to be very average but the shower did have a mult-function shower head. The room service was fast, efficient and the quality of the food was excellent. It was reasonably priced as well. We had breakfast via room service costing $30 for two people. The hotel has a resturant downstairs, next to the lobby but DON'T try it - we had a "hot" breakfast there on our first morning and it was cold and very unappealing. Reading some of the reviews on this website, it seems that other guests have had a similar experience. When I checked out, I mentioned to the staff about the poor resturant breakfast and they were very good about it, reimbursing me for it. The hotel is about 30 minutes walk from downtown vancouver but i felt it was a safer place than the city. There is a London Drugstore a street away, as well as a starbucks and several enthic resturants nearby. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay, especially for a business trip and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KSRNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel Aug 4-8 and was definitely not up to the standards normally found with Holiday Inns in the US. One of the only 2 elevators for the hotel broke the day after we got there and still was not fixed when we left. The sink in the bathroom was clogged and leaked underneath. The bathtub clogged every time you took a shower and the smoke detector also went off when you took a shower. They fixed the sink and we were told that "this happens" with the problem with the smoke detector. Front desk was not very friendly. Complimentary shuttle service to the airport was booked as full every day, at which time we were told that most likely the driver was on vacation. The Stages restaurant adjacent to the hotel was marginal. The hot breakfast was inedible. Paid $174 per night through Liberty Travel. Had we not prepaid the hotel, would have checked out after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: lawdawg076
Reviews.Content: Tried to book a room in the West End/central business district for fireworks/pride weekend but couldn't find anything reasonable. Ended up booking this property on Priceline. I have always been pleasantly surprised with the Holiday Inn brand and this was no exception. Not right downtown, but very easy to get in and out of downtown using the buses, which are clean and efficient (and run late at night!). Hotel is an older property, but room was nicely updated and very, very clean. Room faced east and slightly north with a good view of the east end of downtown (Yaletown), the Expo ball, and the mountains beyond. Room had a balcony looking south and down onto Broadway. Very comfortable bed. Bathroom was updated but countertop was not. Soft towels (unusual for a hotel). Again, very clean. Free high-speed internet is a HUGE plus! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just outside the Centre”
Reviews.Author: lalawgirl
Reviews.Content: I had to say that I was VERY disappointed when I got this hotel when bidding on Priceline for a downtown hotel, as this hotel is not in downtown! It is however, walking distance to Granville Island, and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. The staff was overly accomodating and very friendly, and I was happy to hear that they have a free shuttle to Canada Place (cruise ship terminal). Overall, however, it was a good stay. Nice, clean basic room. We had an AMAZING view of downtown which made for great pictures (as noted by other posters). Security in the hotel is also tight, which is good.

Reviews.Title: “Not Spectacular But Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: querqeekid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just south of the city "core" and just east of Granville Island. While it is a bit out of the "action zone", if you plan to take public transportation (as we did) it's really a great location: a great view of downtown (from the "correct" side of the hotel) and within steps of several of the main bus lines. While it will never rival the big, fancy EXPENSIVE hotels in the city's "core" for amenities, it did the trick just fine. It is clean and decently appointed--a three-star hotel in every sense. The hotel staff were very accomodating and pleasant. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in and our room wasn't ready; however, they got it done within 15 minutes. The housekeeping staff was especially outstanding. By the way, there is a great deal of construction in the area--it will be a very hot neighborhood come Olympics time--but it didn't hamper our stay at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Vancouver Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 711 West Broadway | @ Heather Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V5Z 3Y2, Canada
